page.title: 04FARMING IN SOUTHREPPS
page.content: Holdings vary from a few acres to many hundred. Fields large with few hedges. Acreages have been increased by acquisition of neighbouring vacant land and amalgamation of tenancies. Most farms are owner occupied. There are some Council and private tenancies and one large farming company. Arable farming predominates, but there are intensive pig and poultry units. Crops: wheat-milling compounding. Barley-malting. Sugar beet, potatoes,peas, broad & dwarf beans under contract for freezing, etc.rape, sheep on stubble conifers. All work is mechanised, app. l man per 200 acres. All farms have grain storage facilities, etc. Straw either burnt baled or ploughed in.
